column5: Hello guys.  Im new in toronto , and doesn't really know where to go fishing in the area.  Im not a professional but i really love fishing .  If there any body kind enough to help me started I can pay in food))))  Im a chef))  )))))  Thanks....
Where abouts in Toronto do you live? If you use GOOGLE MAPS or GOOGLE EARTH, it's a really good tool to help you locate places along shore you can fish from.
The Toronto area CA has some great fishing guide maps available. They are always at the Sportsman's show coming up next week.
Could you post a picture of the food?
NORTH YORK AREA . THANKS.

check out Bass Pro shop they have an excellent spot i'm sure you'll find the honey hole LOL.  yea your only about 1hr-2hr drive from really good fishing grounds check out google maps for the lakes in that distance

If you like Perch you are approximately 45 min away from Gilford and Lefroy. Fish near 14 fow to 30 fow as a starting point and you can go deeper or shallower for that matter. Hook and minnows works well but so do the tiny Rapala jigging raps etc...  If you want whitefish and lake trout, Kemp area is about the same distance give or take a little and try Bear Point, Big Bay Point, Innisfil Beach, 6th line 8th line etc... You can find these fish in the 80 fow range as a start and you can can go way shallow or way deeper. You can use hook and minnows, williams jigging spoon, bad boys, meegs, blue fox foxxies etc....  That should get you started!!!
Take the ferry to Toronto Islands and cast the internal ponds.
Serg, you will probably garner more and better info if you would take some time to describe to us, what kinda fish, you past experience and most importantly, what your signature dish is! HH

ok , so last sunday i checked simcoe, no luck, couple of small perch , and froze my balls))  probably not the wright spot ....  but summer time im going usually for bass, pike, carp , but im really not picky,  any fish its a good fish ( the bigger the batter))))  Thanks to all .
You can try Island lake in Oakville for the bass, pike, perch and bluegils  Andrew
